rule, authority, sovereignty; a reign.
Tiberius, the second Roman emperor (died A.D. 37).

the, the definite article.
Galilee, a district towards the southern end of the Roman province Syria; the northern division of Palestine.
Herod; four persons are called by this name: Herod the Great, Herod Antipas, Herod Agrippa, and Herod Agrippa the younger.

Philip, (a) one of the twelve apostles of Jesus, (b) tetrarch of the Ituraean and Trachonitic region, half-brother of Herod Antipas, tetrarch of Galilee, (c) one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem and a missionary.

and, even, also, namely.
Trachonitis, the north-east of the territory beyond Jordan.
(a) a country or region, (b) the land, as opposed to the sea, (c) the country, distinct from town, (d) plur: fields.
and, even, also, namely.
Lysanias, tetrarch of Abilene.
the, the definite article.
the Abilenian territory, the territory of Abila (in Syria), a small principality in the mountains of Damascus.

24.long: (Hebrew), Levi, (a) an ancestor of Jesus, (b) another ancestor of Jesus, (c) third son of Jacob, the patriarch, and founder of a tribe named after him, (d) son of Alphaeus, and called Matthew, a revenue officer and one of the twelve apostles of Jesus.
Melchi, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Jannai, an ancestor of Jesus; Jannai was the son of Joseph, and father of Melchi.

25.long: Amos, son of Manasseh and father of Josiah, an ancestor of Jesus.
Esli, son of Naggai and father of Nahum.
Naggai, one of the ancestors of Jesus.

27.long: Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel (Salathiel) and father of Abiud and Rhesa.

28.long: Melchi, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Addi, son of Cosam, and father of Melchi, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Cosam, son of Elmadam and father of Addi.
Elmadam, father of Cosam, son of Er.
Er, son of Joshua and father of Elmadam.

29.long: Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
Eliezer, son of Joram and father of Joshua.

(Hebrew), Levi, (a) an ancestor of Jesus, (b) another ancestor of Jesus, (c) third son of Jacob, the patriarch, and founder of a tribe named after him, (d) son of Alphaeus, and called Matthew, a revenue officer and one of the twelve apostles of Jesus.

30.long: Eliakim, son of Abiud and father of Azor; son of Melea and father of Jonam.

31.long: Melea, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Nathan, son of David, and an ancestor of Jesus.

32.long: (Hebrew), Jesse, son of Obed, and father of King David.
Boaz, son of Salmon and Rahab, husband of Ruth, father of Obed.
Sala, the name of two of the ancestors of Jesus.
Nahshon, son of Amminadab and father of Salmon, and one of the ancestors of Jesus.

33.long: Amminadab, son of Ram and father of Nahshon, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Amminadab, son of Ram and father of Nahshon, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Ram, son of Hezron and father of Amminadab.
Hezron, son of Perez, father of Ram.
Perez, son of Judah and one of the ancestors of Jesus.

34.long: (Hebrew), Jacob, (a) the patriarch, son of Isaac, (b) father of Joseph, the husband of Mary.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race.
Nahor, one of the ancestors of Jesus.

35.long: Ragau (or Reu), an ancestor of Jesus.
Peleg, son of Eber, and one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Eber, father of Peleg and son of Shelah.
Sala, the name of two of the ancestors of Jesus.

36.long: (Hebrew), Cainan, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
Arphaxad, son of Shem, and father of Cainan.
(Hebrew), Lamech, son of Methuselah and father of Noah.

37.long: (Hebrew) Methuselah, son of Enoch and father of Lamech.
Enoch, son of Jared and father of Methuselah.
(Hebrew), Jared, son of Mahalalel and father of Enoch.
Mahalaleel or Maleleel, one of the ancestors of Jesus.
(Hebrew), Cainan, one of the ancestors of Jesus.

38.long: Enosh (also Enos), son of Seth, and father of Cainan.
Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race.
